title: Factoring
text: Factor the denominator to get $${x\left(x-2\right)}^2$$. To allow for the repeated factor of $$(x-2)$$, the decomposition will include three denominators: $$x$$, $$(x-2)$$, and $$\left(x-2\right)^2$$

title: Separating Denominator Factors
text: Separate the denominator factors and give each numerator a symbolic label like A and B

title: Separating Denominator Factors
text: The equation should now look like: $$-x^2+2x+\frac{4}{x^3-4x^2+4x}=\frac{A}{x}+\frac{B}{x-2}+\frac{C}{\left(x-2\right)^2}$$

title: Eliminating Fractions
text: Multiply both sides of the equation by the common denominator to eliminate the fractions. The resulting equation is $$-x^2+2x+4={A\left(x-2\right)}^2+\operatorname{Bx}\left(x-2\right)+Cx$$

title: System of Equations
text: Expand the right side of the equation and collect like terms, and then set up a system of equations associating corresponding coefficients.

title: Solving Equations
text: The three equations are $$-1=A+B$$ and $$2=-4A-2B+C$$ and $$4A=4$$. From this, solve for A. What is A equal to?

title: Solving Equations
text: Substitute $$A=1$$ into the equation(1) and solve for B. What is B equal to?

title: Solving Equations
text: Substitute the values for A and B into equation(2) to solve for C. What is C equal to?
